attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for persons whom lie to social work.
attributes.additional_details: Persons who are found to be impacting the process of a child or children with false information or accusations being returned to their parent should face prosecution. This is child abuse which goes unnoticed in the system and impacts the decisions made on where the said child/children will remain or live with.
attributes.background: Prevent children from suffering from the emotional effects and damage of being kept or seperated from a parent due the lies and false information provided to social work effecting the process of said children being returned to the parent.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about social services in Scotland are a matter for the Scottish Government, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here: http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx
